Opening a cell - it may contain: \n 1) mine 2) number 3) nothing \n 1.If you open a cell with a mine, you lose; \n 2. The number in the cell shows how many mines are hidden in the immediately adjacent cells; \n 3.If there is nothing in an open cell, this is equivalent to zero minutes around this cell; \n \n
In order to complete the game you need: \n 1. Open all cells, except those in which mines are located; \n 2.All cells with mines - mark with a flag. \n
On the playing field in the lower right corner there is an icon of the selected action \n If there is a "Flag" there: \n when you touch a cell on the field - this cell is marked with a flag. \n If the cell has already been marked with a flag before, the flag is removed. \n \n
If the Shovel icon is selected: \n when you touch a cell on the field, it opens it. \n If the cell is marked with a flag, or is open, it has no effect. \n \n
----------- \n
There is a slider at the bottom of the screen, the value of which determines the size of the cells on the margin. \n \n
----------- \n
If not all cells fit on the screen, the minefield can be scrolled. For this you need to slide the pressed finger along the field horizontally or vertically, depending on from the desired direction. \n \n
----------- \n
There is a timer at the top of the screen. If the time expires, the player will automatically assigned defeat \n If there is no time limit, it acts as a stopwatch. \n
At the moment there are 3 game modes in the game:\n 1. Campaign \n 2. Own game \n 3. Bluetooth play \n \n
In the campaign, the player is asked to complete levels with pre-prepared settings. \n In your game, you need to set the settings for the game yourself before playing. \n 2 people participate in the bluetooth game. One of the players must create the game, and the second is to connect to it. Whoever solves the card faster is the winner. \n
Several things are required to play via bluetooth: \n 1. Bluetooth enabled; \n 2. Configured pairing via bluetooth with the second player; \n \n
1. One player must act as a "Server" and create a game. \n 2. The second player, the "Client", after the first creation of the game players, must go to the "Client" section of the Bluetooth game mode. There will be a list of all paired devices. Among them, you must select the first Name of the first player. \n \n The game continues until at least one of the players loses, or until at least one of the players wins. \n
